ActsAsSpatial

=======

SUMMARY 

 - brings true GIS spatial querying support to the ActiveRecord find method
 - uses PostGIS functions rather than executing geometric calculations directly in the SQL query
 - given a point, line, or polygon, find all geometries within the layer that intersect, overlap, contain, touch or are within a given geometry.

INSTALL Make sure you‘ve got Georuby: sudo gem install georuby or you can get it at rubyforge.org/projects/georuby/ Next, make sure you‘ve got a PostgreSQL database up and running with the PostGIS Adapter. You can find installation instructions for your specific operating system here: www.postgis.org/download/ For geocoding services, you‘ll need the Graticule gem: sudo gem install graticule You‘re also going to want the Spatial Extension which provides seamless interaction with geographic columns: script/plugin install svn://rubyforge.org/var/svn/georuby/SpatialAdapter/trunk/spatial_adapter and, finally, install the plugin: script/plugin install git://github.com/webmapps/acts_as_spatial.git

REQUIREMENTS This plugin will only work with PostgreSQL and the PostGIS adapter. It will not work with MySQL. The database must be loaded with the PostGIS functions, and have a geometry column. This plugin currently does not auto-geocode, so you‘ll have to take care of that stuff yourself. More features coming soon.

USAGE In your models: class Property < ActiveRecord::Base 

       acts_as_spatial # assumes the geometry column is
                                           # called "the_geom" but can be
                                           # specified by passing :geom => 'column_name"

end

In your controllers: Property.find(:all, :contain => ‘POINT(-71.488049 41.791564)’) Property.find(:first, :overlap => ‘POLYGON ((1 1, 1 3, 3 3, 3 1, 1 1 ))’) Property.find(:last, :intersect => ‘LINESTRING (0 2, 4 2)’)

You can even combine multiple spatial queries: Property.find(:all, :contain => ‘POINT(-71.488049 41.791564)’, :overlap => ‘POLYGON ((1 1, 1 3, 3 3, 3 1, 1 1 ))’)

…or even pair a spatial query with the ActiveRecord conditions Hash like so: Property.find(:all, :conditions => { :hot_tub_size => ‘huge’ }, :within => ‘POLYGON ((1 1, 1 3, 3 3, 3 1, 1 1 ))’)

Enjoy! More features coming soon.
